title: Satellite Pics: Did India Target Underground Facility At Pak's Murid Air Base?
content: New high-resolution satellite images, accessed by NDTV, show extensive damage to the Murid air base of Pakistan, showing a three-metre-wide crater just 30 metres from an underground facility of the Pakistan Air Force.

title: 6 Of Family Die Inside Car, 7th Sitting Outside Said "Will Die In 5 Mins"
content: The dead have been identified as Praveen Mittal, 42, his elderly parents, wife and three young children - two girls and a boy.

title: "Karnataka Politicians Misunderstood": Chandrababu Naidu Amid HAL Row
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday dismissed reports suggesting that he has sought the relocation of Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) from Karnataka to the state.

title: Hamas Gaza Chief Muhammad Sinwar Killed By Israel Army: Netanyahu
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced on Wednesday that Hamas' Gaza chief Muhammad Sinwar has been killed by Israel's army.

title: Lokpal's Clean Chit To Ex-SEBI Chief Madhabi Puri Buch In Alleged Market Fraud Case
content: Anti-corruption ombudsman Lokpal on Wednesday disposed of complaints alleging impropriety and conflict of interest against former SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch based on a Hindenburg Research report, terming the charges as "presumptions and assumptions

title: Auto Driver Arrested In Maharashtra For Killing Passenger Over Fare Dispute In 2001
content: The police in Maharashtra's Palghar district have arrested a man, who used to drive an autorickshaw, for allegedly killing a passenger over a fare dispute in 2001, an official said on Wednesday.

title: How Trump's "Big Beautiful Bill" Discriminates Against Single Parents
content: The particular vulnerability in the SNAP system is that even if children are guaranteed SNAP benefits, the overall household's food security can be significantly impacted when an adult loses SNAP benefits.

title: 40-Year-Old Patient Dies Of COVID-19 At Chandigarh Hospital
content: A 40-year-old patient on Wednesday succumbed to COVID-19 virus at the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), Sector 32, said an official.

title: Fearless Force That Scripted The End Of Maoist Terror In Bastar
content: The lush but deadly jungles of Abujhmad in Chhattisgarh -- long considered the impenetrable heartland of Naxal operations -- recently witnessed a turning point.

title: Spain Denies Power Grid "Experiment" Caused Massive Blackout
content: Spain's government on Wednesday denied a press report that an "experiment" on the national power grid caused a huge blackout that crippled the Iberian Peninsula one month ago.

title: 'Trikal' Whisky Denied Sale Permission In Uttarakhand After Outcry Over Name
content: The Uttarakhand government has denied granting permission for the production, sale, or registration of Radico Khaitan's newly launched whisky brand 'Trikal', amid rising public outcry over the brand name's religious connotation.

title: Opinion: Blog | 30 Terrifying Minutes On A Delhi-Srinagar Flight That Changed My Life - By Derek O'Brien
content: We see lightning, clearly visible as it stabs through daylight. Now there is some turbulence, but it progresses rapidly. I realise this is not your regular turbulence. This is severe, the likes I've never experienced on my frequent flyer miles before

title: "Crimes Against Humanity": UN Experts On Russia's Drone Attack In Ukraine
content: Russia's military has committed "crimes against humanity" and "war crimes" in its drone attacks on civilians in Ukraine's Kherson region, UN experts concluded in a report published Wednesday.

title: "44 MLAs Agreed To Form Government": Manipur BJP MLA After Meeting Governor
content: In a big political development in Manipur, BJP MLA and former minister Thokchom Radheshyam on Wednesday said "all 44 MLAs" have agreed to form the government as per the wishes of the people, but the final decision will be taken by central leaders.

title: Elon Musk's xAI, Telegram Partner To Distribute Grok To Messaging App's Users
content: Elon Musk's AI start-up xAI will pay Telegram $300 million to deploy its Grok chatbot on the messaging app, aiming to tap the platform's more than one billion users and sharpen its competitive edge in the booming artificial intelligence market.

title: Rajasthan Government Employee Who 'Visited Pakistan' Detained For Probe: Cops
content: A Rajasthan government employee was picked up for interrogation on suspicion of spying for Pakistan on Wednesday.

title: French Court Convicts Retired Surgeon Of Rape, Sexual Assault Of Patients
content: A French court on Wednesday found a retired surgeon guilty of the rape and sexual assault of patients, some of them whilst under anaesthetic, in a trial that has shaken France.

title: 7 Dead As Migrant Boat Capsizes Near Canary Islands Port In Spain
content: At least seven people died when a migrant boat capsized as rescuers were escorting it to port in Spain's Canary Islands, regional emergency services said on Wednesday.

title: Elon Musk's Critique Of Trump's "Big, Beautiful" Bill Sparks Talk Of Rift
content: Billionaire Elon Musk said he was "disappointed" with US President Donald Trump's legislative push for a massive spending package, which includes multi-trillion dollar tax breaks, saying doing so will only "increase the budget deficit".

title: Putin Wants Pledge To Halt NATO Enlargement For Ukraine Peace: Report
content: President Vladimir Putin's conditions for ending the war in Ukraine include a demand that Western leaders pledge in writing to stop enlarging NATO eastwards and lift a chunk of sanctions on Russia, according to three Russian sources.

title: Two men spend five months in jail after police mistake rock sugar for MDMA
content: The duo say they told DANSAF officers that they were using rock sugar as a ‘side dish’ for consuming liquor, but officers refused to pay heed and arrested them on charge of drug peddling. They were released on the 151st day of remand after a chemical test result proved their claim right. The officers say they acted on credible information and that the duo were duped

title: Inadequate diagnostic services still a critical gap in cancer care in India: NAMS report
content: Patients in India tend to present with later stage disease compared to the West, latest report by the National Academy of Medical Sciences states; nearly 200,000 new cancer cases are reported each year

title: Joint efforts by officials, NGO save a three-year-old from life on streets
content: The minor’s father, who is a rag-picker and has no permanent residence, signed a ‘Surrender deed’ to leave his son under the care of District Child Protection Officer P. Dinesh Kumar

title: Did not seek shifting of HAL from Karnataka to Andhra Pradesh, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Denying media reports and political allegations to this effect, Naidu says he only sought Centre’s support to transform the State into an aerospace and defence industries hub

title: Incremental authoritarianism at work in India, says N. Ram
content: PM Modi and President Trump share an authoritarian disdain for their countries’ Constitutions, says Mr. Ram; says investigative journalism must raise social awareness to stand the test of time

title: Artificial Intelligence brings NTR to life at TDP’s Mahanadu in Kadapa
content: In the AI-generated video clip, the former Chief Minister is shown as appreciating the phenomenal rise of the TDP through the 43 years of its existence, its mission, and the future ahead

title: CAG suggests digitisation of TUDA accounts
content: The CAG team reviewed various developmental activities such as the layouts, land acquisition, and park development

title: Rain fury: KSEB suffers huge loss in Kozhikode
content: KSEB officials report the destruction of over 1,100 LT conductors and 20 HT conductors due to recent rain-related calamities

title: Be wary of criminals in politics and coverts in party, Chandrababu Naidu cautions TDP cadres
content: He cites as example how the conspirators in the Vivekananda Reddy murder case pointed the finger of blame at him

title: Need to encourage leaders like Pinarayi Vijayan: Kamal Haasan
content: Documentary, titled Pinarayi the Legend, brought out by Kerala Secretariat Employees’ Association released as part of the  fourth anniversary celebrations of the second Pinarayi-led LDF government

title: Congress takes on Modi government over India Inc’s rising foreign investments
content: Citing The Hindu report on concerns about rising outward FDI, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh blames stagnant wages, low consumption demand, tax terrorism, complicated GST rules, and poor governance

title: Assam: AIUDF protests harassment of Muslims by branding them foreigners
content: Party leaders submitted a memorandum to Assam Governor Lakhsman Prasad Acharya after 14 people, reportedly pushed back into Bangladesh, were left stranded on no-man’s land

title: International Fleet Review and MILAN to be conducted in Visakhapatnam in February 2026
content: Chief of Staff of ENC Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena meets Chief Secretary Vijayanand to discuss about the international maritime exercise

title: The 2025 NFL season FPI projections are out: Eagles at No. 1, Saints at No. 32 in our debut ratings
content: ESPN's Football Power Index ratings are live. Let's predict the 2025 season, including playoff chances for 32 teams and potential draft order.

title: Haliburton's historic triple-double keys Game 4 win
content: Tyrese Haliburton had 32 points, 15 assists and 12 rebounds without a turnover for a historic playoff triple-double in the Pacers' Game 4 win over the Knicks.

title: Perry, 40, helps Oilers to cusp of Cup Final return
content: Veteran forward Corey Perry, 40, scored the tiebreaking goal on a power play in the second period, as the Edmonton Oilers defeated the Dallas Stars 4-1 on Tuesday night to take a 3-1 lead in the Western Conference finals headed into Thursday's Game 5.

title: Bradshaw: Steelers' interest in Rodgers 'a joke'
content: Four-time Super Bowl-winning quarterback Terry Bradshaw, a Steelers legend, isn't a fan of the Pittsburgh's pursuit of Aaron Rodgers, telling an Arkansas radio station on Tuesday that the club's interest in the 41-year-old signal-caller "is just a joke."

title: CFP 5+11 model draws interest from SEC coaches
content: In a pivot from the push for automatic qualifiers in the next iteration of the College Football Playoff, the SEC on Tuesday took a heightened interest in a 16-team model that would include the five highest-ranked conference champions and 11 at-large bids.

title: WNBA can't verify hateful comments toward Reese
content: The WNBA said it was unable to substantiate allegations of "hateful fan comments" directed toward Angel Reese during a game against the Fever.

title: Kemp pleads guilty to assault charge in shooting
content: Former NBA star Shawn Kemp, 55, a six-time NBA All-Star, pleaded guilty to an assault charge Tuesday for shooting at two men inside a vehicle in a Washington state mall parking lot, and he is now due to be sentenced in August in Tacoma, Washington.

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Pacers go up 3-1 on the Knicks
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: The 5 most astounding stats behind the 100-game stretch when the Tigers have ruled MLB
content: Detroit has been the best team in baseball since Aug. 11 of last season. Here's a breakdown of how it has done it.

content: Wolverhampton Wanderers have given Manchester United permission to conclude a deal for Matheus Cunha, sources told ESPN.

title: Henry: Arsenal have underachieved under Arteta
content: Arsenal legend Thierry Henry has said he believes the club should have won a trophy under Mikel Arteta.

title: Slot thanks football after Liverpool parade incident
content: Liverpool's Arne Slot thanked the football community for its support following the incident at Liverpool's title parade after being named LMA manager of the year.

title: UCL: Pot 1 teams will play two English clubs
content: The six non-English teams in Pot 1 of the Champions League draw will have to be given fixtures against two Premier League clubs in the league phase.

title: Maresca surprised Mudryk in Poland for final
content: Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca seemed as surprised as anyone when he was told Mykhailo Mudryk had been spotted in Poland ahead of the club's Conference League final against Real Betis.

title: Source: Liverpool's Heitinga can begin Ajax talks
content: Liverpool have granted assistant coach John Heitinga permission to enter talks with Ajax over becoming their new head coach, a source has told ESPN.

title: Mourinho: Man United right to stick with Amorim
content: Jose Mourinho believes former club Manchester United are doing the right thing by sticking with coach Ruben Amorim despite their disappointing season.

title: England's Bright out of camp due to burnout
content: Millie Bright has said she withdrew from this England camp because she is "mentally and physically" at her limit.

title: The story of Arsenal's season: Did not signing a striker cost them the title?
content: A season that began with great optimism ended with Arsenal taking one step back in the Premier League but also a leap forward in the Champions League.

title: Storylines: Can Nelly Korda get back in the winner's circle? How will Erin Hills play?
content: The 80th U.S. Women's Open figures to be a tough test at Erin Hills Club. We break down some of the biggest things to watch ahead of the LPGA's second major of the year.

title: Valkyries coach Natalie Nakase making history in the WNBA
content: Former Clippers assistant Natalie Nakase helped the Aces win two WNBA titles. Now she's in her first season as the head coach of the Valkyries.

content: Bill Connelly begins his conference previews with the MAC, which still has some high-level talent despite portal losses.

content: What we learned and what's ahead for the Oilers, who lead the Stars 3-1 in the Western Conference finals.

title: Who has the early edge for MVP, Cy Young and more? Inside the numbers on MLB's biggest awards
content: With Memorial Day weekend behind us, it's time to take our first look at the leaders for MVP, Cy Young and more.

title: Memorial Day standings check: Playoff predictions, biggest surprises, more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

content: The French Open is the last of the majors to use human line judges -- and it's been a topic of debate in Paris.

title: Shortage of doctors hits Peravoor taluk hospital in Kannur; KGMOA stages protest
content: The only gynaecologist is forced to work round the clock, and the services of the night emergency department have been suspended due to staff crunch, alleges KGMOA

title: Tirupati DFO stresses on native plant varieties for better green cover
content: The District Forest Officer urges local communities, volunteers and nature lovers to safeguard native varieties; also describes the Seshachalam Biosphere Reserve as a harmonious blend of spirituality and nature

title: Life sentence for college teacher who plotted sensational murder in Odisha
content: Punjilal Meher, a teacher, harboured resentment and jealousy towards a female colleague who was promoted ahead of him, and during her son’s wedding, he sent parcel bomb he had learnt to make from YouTube videos

title: TMC (M) moves Madras High Court to condone delay in filing monetary contribution reports before Election Commission
content: The delay had resulted in the Income Tax department denying tax exemptions for the contributions received by the party in 2018-19 and 2019-20

title: Kamal Haasan clarifies on Kannada remark: It was a statement of love
content: Actor Kamal Haasan has responded to the controversy around his remark on the Kannada language, and defended his statement by calling it an expression of love

title: PIL opposes Friday prayers on public road outside mosque in Coimbatore
content: “We are a multi-religious country. So, reasonable accommodation must be extended by people of every faith,” says Justice Senthilkumar Ramamoorthy

title: APSSDC to host mega job mela at Mulakalacheruvu on May 31
content: Several leading companies, including Aaradhya HR Solutions, Yazaki Engineering Ltd., Wistron, Foxconn, and Muthoot Finance, will be participating in the recruitment drive

title: Union Cabinet approves ₹3,653-crore four-lane Badvel-Nellore NH
content: Proposed corridor will reduce distance to Krishanpatnam port by 34 km, from 142 km to 108 km compared to the existing Badvel-Nellore road; this will cut travel time by an hour and substantially reduce fuel consumption

title: Over 5,000 participate in yoga camp at Madanapalle
content: District Collector Sridhar Chamakuri asks senior citizens and women to make use of the public parks in Madanapalle for morning walks and yoga

title: Preliminary assessment shows Kerala may need 6,500 more polling stations: Chief Electoral Officer Rathan U. Kelkar
content: He says all new polling stations will be permanent ones as the concept of ‘auxiliary polling stations/booths’ has been done away

title: Governor Abdul Nazeer, Chief Secretary Vijayanand pay tributes to NTR on his birth anniversary
content: They recall the efforts made by the late leader in empowering women, rolling out welfare schemes, and in uplifting the Telugu pride at the national and international levels

title: CM exhorts students from dalit and marginalised communities to shed inferiority complex and compete with others
content: Recalls how the BRS government implemented schemes like cattle, sheep and fish seed distribution rather than focusing on education of dalits and marginalised sections; criticises them for playing with lives of unemployed without issuing job notifications for 10 years

title: Bodies of three boys retrieved from the Gowthami in West Godavari district
content: The victims drowned when they tried to have a bath in the river, a branch of the Godavari, at Raavi Lanka

title: Unbecoming of a judge: High Court on denial of urgent hearing to plea of man for ailing son's custody
content: Bombay High Court criticizes family court judge for denying urgent hearing on father’s plea for son’s surgery custody

title: With four more testing positive, number of COVID-19 patients in Patna reaches 10
content: Government hospitals in the city have been asked to remain prepared and ensure the availability of beds, oxygen, medicines, and vaccines

title: T.N. CM Stalin seeks Nirmala Sitharaman’s intervention against RBI’s fresh gold loan norms
content: In a letter to the Union Finance Minister, the Tamil Nadu Chief Minister highlights the major implications of the new rules, including disruption of access to formal credit for the rural populace and the potential rise in their reliance on informal lending channels

title: A 105-year legacy: Hyderabad’s Jauzi Halwa which takes 16 hours to make
content: Crafting a single batch takes 16 hours, with workers stirring in shifts to achieve its signature consistency

title: Make Lokesh TDP’s working president, MLAs appeal to Naidu at Mahanadu
content: The HRD Minister deserves it for reviving the sagging fortunes of the party amidst heavy odds, they say

title: TDB’s move to reshuffle mahouts triggers row; activists raise alarm
content: Objectors say abrupt changes in mahout-elephant pairings can negatively impact the animals’ health and well-being

title: Udit Raj targeting Tharoor at Rahul Gandhi's behest for keeping national interest above party: BJP
content: He (Shashi Tharoor) talked about national interest, not his party’s interest. He is being attacked because he kept national policy above the vote bank (politics), says BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla.

title: Cabinet approves two multi-tracking railway projects in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh
content: The two projects covering four districts across Maharashtra, and Madhya Pradesh, will increase the existing network of Indian Railways by about 176 km

title: Haryana to conduct drills under ‘Operation Shield’ across all 22 districts on May 29
content: Apart from a drill scheduled to take place between 5 p.m. and 9 p.m., a controlled blackout will be observed from 8 p.m. to 8.15 p.m. near vital installations, with essential emergency services

title: Actor Kamal Haasan is not aware of Kannada’s ancient history: CM Siddaramaiah
content: Kamal Haasan’s comments sparked outrage among several Kannada outfits, who staged protests in various parts of the state like Belagavi, Mysuru Hubballi, Bengaluru, among others.

title: Anna University sexual assault case: Palaniswami, Vijay slam T.N. CM Stalin over credit for verdict
content: Notwithstanding the judgment, certain questions regarding the DMK government had not been answered yet, the AIADMK general secretary said

title: FSSAI asks States/Union Territories to take measures for addressing obesity
content: FSSAI urges states to combat obesity with awareness programs and concrete measures, responding to PM’s call for action

title: Aligarh mob attack case: Seized meat sample did not belong to 'cow or any cow progeny', says report
content: This revelation comes after a violent mob attacked four men on May 24, suspecting them of transporting meat of prohibited cattle.

title: Series of earthquakes strike Manipur
content: Three earthquakes hit Manipur on Wednesday, including a 5.2 and 3.9 magnitude in Churachandpur and a 2.5 in Noney

title: Indian Embassy in Iran says taken up missing Indians’ case with Iranian authorities
content: The Embassy said it has strongly taken up this matter with the Iranian authorities, and requested that the missing Indians should be “urgently traced and their safety should be ensured.”

title: Government approves continuation of interest subvention scheme for farmers
content: Under Modified Interest Subvention Scheme, the farmers get short-term loans of up to ₹3 lakh through Kisan Credit Card at a subsidised interest rate of 7%, with a 1.5% interest subvention provided to eligible lending institutions

title: IndiGo appoints Vikram Singh Mehta as Chairman
content: IndiGo said Vikram Singh Mehta succeeds Venkataramani Sumantran who stepped down from the post after the completion of his five-year term as a board member

title: J&K statehood talks still alive, regardless of Pahalgam attack: Omar Abdullah
content: The conversation around statehood has not stalled. The only thing I was unwilling to do was to use the special session of the (Jammu and Kashmir) Assembly to talk about statehood. But that does not mean the conversation has stopped, says Chief Minister Omar Abdullah

title: Congress claims most Indians locked out of consumption economy; cites auto sales figures
content: "Weak consumption in the domestic economy means manufacturers have no incentive to set up new factories or create new capacity for domestic markets," Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: 2008 Mumbai attacks: Court seeks Tihar's response on Tahawwur Rana's plea
content: Special Judge Chander Jit Singh issued notice to jail authorities on Rana's plea and directed them to also file a status report in the matter by June 4, the next date of hearing.

title: Student held for post on India-Pakistan conflict released from Pune jail
content: On Tuesday, the HC came down heavily on the government for its "absolutely shocking" and "radical" response to the girl's social media post

title: 'Plot of C-grade movie': Gogoi clarifies wife's 'Pak links'; Assam CM doubles down on 'spy' charge
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi has refuted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's allegations of his wife's ISI connection, dismissing it as a fabricated story. Sarma claims Gogoi has ties with the Pakistani establishment and promises to reveal evidence after an investigation. Gogoi questions the timing of the accusations, while Sarma welcomes Gogoi's admission of visiting Pakistan.

title: How China became Harvard’s greatest liability - and Trump, MAGA's latest battleground
content: In a stunning move, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security has revoked Harvard University's ability to enroll foreign students, citing alleged ties to the Chinese Communist Party and a hostile campus environment marked by antisemitism. Secretary Kristi Noem accused Harvard of CCP coordination and fostering violence, impacting over 6,000 international students.

title: US imposes visa curbs on foreign nationals who 'censor Americans'
content: The United States has declared a new visa restriction policy aimed at foreign individuals who suppress the free speech rights of American citizens abroad. Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced that this policy will target foreign officials and individuals complicit in censoring Americans. This includes those who fine, harass, or criminally charge US.

title: 'Will blacken Rahul's face': Sena (UBT) leader sparks row over 'Savarkar insult'
content: A political clash erupted within the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance as Shiv Sena (UBT) threatened Rahul Gandhi over his remarks about Savarkar, with one leader vowing to blacken his face. Congress defended Gandhi, citing historical references and asserting their ability to handle such threats. The incident highlights tensions within the opposition coalition.

title: America’s Apparel group slams Trump after he prioritises tech over clothing manufacturing
content: President Trump prioritizes boosting U.S. manufacturing of high-tech and military equipment through tariffs, downplaying the textile industry's significance. While aiming for advancements in AI, chips, and defense, this approach faces criticism. The American Apparel & Footwear Association warns of potential harm to the industry, citing increased costs for manufacturers and higher prices for consumers.

title: Haasan clarifies Tamil-Kannada remark after sparking fresh language row
content: Kamal Hasan's claim that "Kannada is born out of Tamil" ignited a language row, prompting criticism from Karnataka's Chief Minister and BJP president. Hasan later clarified that politicians, including himself, are unqualified to discuss language origins and suggested leaving it to linguists. He faced threats from Karnataka Rakshana Vedike for allegedly disrespecting Kannada.

title: Bowel cancer is rising rapidly in younger people: Causes and symptoms
content: Scientists have discovered that a bacterial toxin, colibactin, may contribute to the rising rates of bowel cancer in young adults. Exposure to this toxin, produced by certain E. coli strains, during childhood could elevate the risk of developing the disease later in life. The toxin causes DNA mutations, making it more common in adults diagnosed with cancer before age 40.

title: 'You made Rathi feel small': Ashwin hits out at Rishabh Pant
content: Ravichandran Ashwin, who has been under scrutiny himself since the controversial run-out of Jos Buttler in IPL 2019, stood firmly in support of Lucknow Super Giants bowler Digvesh Rathi on Wednesday. Speaking on his YouTube channel, Ashwin dissected the incident involving Rathi’s attempt to dismiss Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s stand-in captain Jitesh Sharma at the non-striker’s end during their IPL 2025 clash.

title: Elon Musk’s 72-hr ‘ultimatum’ to Apple that may have split Tim Cook’s team
content: In 2022, Elon Musk issued a 72-hour ultimatum to Apple, demanding a $5 billion deal for SpaceX to become the exclusive satellite provider for iPhones. Apple rejected the offer, leading to a three-year conflict involving regulatory challenges and internal dissent within Apple regarding its satellite strategy. Despite the challenges and internal resistance, Apple has invested heavily in Globalstar, signaling its commitment to satellite connectivity.

title: Trump’s social media eyes $2.5 bn investment for 'bitcoin treasury'
content: Trump Media & Technology Group, operator of Truth Social, plans to secure $2.5 billion, including establishing a "bitcoin treasury." The company secured agreements with institutional investors for $1.5 billion in common stock and $1.0 billion in convertible notes.

title: PM Modi speaks to Ghulam Nabi Azad after health scare during MP delegation tour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inquired about Ghulam Nabi Azad's health after the senior leader was hospitalized in Riyadh during an all-party MP delegation tour. Azad is now recovering in Kuwait and reports his test results are normal. BJP MP Baijayant Panda, leading the delegation, noted Azad's absence will be felt in Saudi Arabia and Algeria.

title: Dead Men Walking: List of terrorists killed by Israel post Oct 7
content: On October 26, 2023 — 19 days after the Hamas-led massacre on Israeli soil left over 1,200 dead and hundreds taken hostage — Israel’s Prime Minister declared, “All Hamas members are dead men walking — above and below ground, inside and outside Gaza.” It sounded like war rhetoric. It turned out to be a declaration of intent. Over the next 18 months, that promise morphed into one of the most relentless, far-reaching, and unapologetic assassination campaigns ever carried out by a democratic state.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' students getting into college: The world you are entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: Ex-Sebi chief Madhabi Buch gets clean chit over Hindenburg charges
content: The Lokpal has cleared former Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch of corruption allegations stemming from a Hindenburg Research report. The anti-corruption ombudsman deemed the complaints "untenable" and lacking credible evidence. Buch and her husband had previously refuted claims of involvement in the 'Adani money siphoning scandal', dismissing them as baseless.

title: 'Then shoot me': Inside Hasina's defiance before exit from Bangladesh
content: In August 2024, Sheikh Hasina's premiership reached a dramatic climax as protests engulfed Dhaka. Refusing to resign despite immense pressure from military officials and even her own sister, Hasina initially resisted. Ultimately, it was her son, Sajeeb Wazed Joy, who convinced her to step down, leading to her exile in India as the military took control.

title: Gambhir's angry 'selector' remark over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion
content: Shubman Gill is set to lead India in the upcoming Test series against England, with Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. Karun Nair makes a comeback after eight years, while Shreyas Iyer is notably absent. Gautam Gambhir declined to comment on Iyer's exclusion. Iyer's leadership will be tested as Punjab Kings face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL 2025 Qualifier 1.

title: 3 Indians missing in Iran: Embassy pushes Tehran to act urgently
content: The Indian Embassy in Tehran is actively collaborating with Iranian authorities to locate three Indian citizens reported missing after traveling to Iran. Prompted by concerns raised by the families, the embassy has urged the Iranian government for an immediate and thorough investigation to ensure the safety of the missing individuals.

title: Op Sindoor: TMC's smart pivot, Congress' missed opportunity
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Abhishek Banerjee's strong stance against Pakistan resonated with the Indian diaspora in Tokyo. Shashi Tharoor criticised Trump's India-Pakistan hyphenation, but Congress missed leveraging his expertise. TMC's calibrated nationalism contrasts with Congress's approach, marked by attacks on Jaishankar. While TMC aligns with the national mood, Congress faces criticism for its messaging, potentially impacting its political narrative.

title: Manipur govt formation: 44 MLAs ready to stake claim, says BJP leader
content: Following a meeting with the governor, BJP legislator Thokchom Radheshyam Singh claimed that 44 Manipur MLAs are prepared to form a new government, citing public sentiment. The move comes amidst ongoing ethnic tensions and President's Rule, implemented after the previous chief minister stepped down due to criticism over handling the Meitei-Kuki conflict, which has caused significant unrest and displacement.

title: Chandrababu Naidu retains TDP helm after 30 years of leadership
content: N Chandrababu Naidu has been re-elected as the president of the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) for another two years. The announcement was made at the party's annual Mahanadu conclave, where TDP Election Committee Chairman Varla Ramaiah declared Naidu's unopposed election after receiving backing from around 600 TDP leaders.

title: Chandigarh reports first Covid death: Firozabad patient succumbs at GMCH
content: Chandigarh reported its first COVID-19 fatality with a 40-year-old patient from Uttar Pradesh, referred from Ludhiana, succumbing to the infection. The patient, who had no comorbidities, was admitted with severe respiratory problems and tested positive before passing away. Health authorities are on high alert, urging citizens to adhere to preventive measures and COVID-appropriate behavior to contain the spread.

title: India-Pak tensions: Civil defence drills to be held in 4 border states
content: India will conduct civil defence mock drills in Gujarat, Rajasthan, Punjab, and Jammu and Kashmir on Thursday. These drills aim to evaluate emergency response coordination and civilian evacuation plans in the event of cross-border conflicts or terror attacks. This exercise follows Operation Sindoor, India's retaliatory strike on terror camps in Pakistan and PoJK after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Bonanza for farmers: Govt hikes MSP for Kharif crops, offers low-interest loans
content: The Union Cabinet has approved increased Minimum Support Prices for 14 Kharif crops for the 2025-26 season, with the highest hike for nigerseed. Paddy MSP rises to Rs 2,369 per quintal. Simultaneously, the Modified Interest Subvention Scheme continues, offering farmers affordable credit via Kisan Credit Cards with subsidized interest rates and incentives for timely repayment.

title: Scientists warn of disastrous asteroids hidden near Venus
content: A new threat looms as scientists warn of dangerous asteroids near Venus, hidden from Earth's telescopes by the Sun's glare. These Venus co-orbitals, including asteroids like 2020 SB, pose a collision risk due to their unstable orbits. Experts urge for dedicated space missions to monitor this blind spot and enhance planetary defence, safeguarding Earth from potential catastrophic impacts.

title: 'Prajwal Revanna’s phone had 2k obscene photos, 40 videos; mother knew about it'
content: Prajwal Revanna's car driver testified that Prajwal's mother, Bhavani Revanna, was aware of his son's habit of recording intimate moments with women. The driver, N Kartik, revealed that Prajwal's phone contained numerous explicit photos and videos. After Kartik showed Bhavani the evidence, she expressed disappointment and requested him to keep the information confidential, later leading to Prajwal confronting Kartik.

title: Narrow escape for 180 passengers as Air India Express flight aborts landing in Chennai
content: An Air India Express flight carrying 180 passengers from Singapore narrowly avoided disaster at Chennai airport on Wednesday. The Airbus aborted its landing just before touchdown due to a high descent rate and sudden crosswinds. The pilots executed a go-around, and the flight landed safely on its second attempt 30 minutes later.

title: Tom Brady ditches NFL life for Italian women, big money & ...
content: Tom Brady is thriving post-divorce, making waves from Venice to Las Vegas. He's transitioned from NFL icon to media mogul with a record-breaking Fox Sports contract and an active role as a minority owner of the Raiders, influencing team decisions. Brady is embracing personal freedom and enjoying a new chapter filled with power and leisure.

title: Broken businesses, fractured bonds: What drove Panchkula family of 7 to mass suicide
content: Burdened by financial failures and mounting debts, Praveen Mittal, a 42-year-old, allegedly took his own life along with six family members in Panchkula. His struggles included a failed scrap business in Baddi and an unsuccessful tour company in Dehradun, leading to immense strain.

title: MLC: Aim is to get cricket in NCAA, says Seattle Orcas CEO Hemant Dua
content: Seattle Orcas CEO Hemant Dua believes cricket will carve out a space for itself in the USA. He says if Major League Cricket (MLC) along with the other stakeholders can work hand in hand, then sky is the limit for cricket's expansion in the US. In a free-wheeling interview with TimesofIndia.com, Dua spoke at length about the various issues, the challenges, the ambition, and how MLC is taking its baby steps in the USA.

title: ‘Debt-trapped’ family of four found hanging at Thiruvananthapuram home
content: In a tragic incident, a family of four was discovered deceased at their Vakkom home on Tuesday, with police suspecting suicide. The deceased are Anil Kumar, his wife Sheeja, and their two sons, Ashwin and Akash. Preliminary investigations suggest a financial crisis, exacerbated by a home loan and medical expenses from Ashwin's accident in 2019, as the potential cause.

title: 'PM chuppi todo': Congress targets Centre after US claim on India-Pak ceasefire
content: Jairam Ramesh, a Congress leader, has targeted the Modi government. This follows claims by US Commerce Secretary Howard Luttnick. Luttnick stated that President Trump used tariffs to broker a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Ramesh is urging Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address the issue. He highlights Trump's previous assertions and similar statements from US officials.

title: Watch that label closely: Water bottled as ‘Bilseri’ at this Noida factory
content: In Greater Noida, authorities raided two factories illegally packaging drinking water without proper licenses. The food department seized 13,092 one-litre bottles and halted operations at Gupta Enterprises and Parametro Waser Technology. Officials are testing water samples to ensure safety standards are met, as both plants violated food safety norms.

title: California sports body widens entry for ‘biological female’ athletes amid trans row
content: Following public outcry over a transgender athlete's participation, the California Interscholastic Federation (CIF) has introduced a pilot program to allow more 'biological female' athletes to compete in the state track-and-field championships. This decision comes after criticism from figures like former President Trump and Governor Newsom, sparking debate over fairness in girls' sports and prompting threats of federal funding cuts.

title: 'Destroyed last aircraft': Israel strikes Yemen's Sanaa airport
content: Following Huthi's missile launches towards Israel, Israeli fighter jets struck Huthi targets at Sanaa airport in Yemen, destroying aircraft. Israel's defense minister declared this a clear message that such actions would face severe consequences. The Israeli military stated the targeted aircraft were used for terrorist activities against Israel, similar to previous strikes on Hodeida and Salif ports.

title: IndiGo named first airline to operate from Navi Mumbai airport
content: IndiGo will be the first airline to operate from the Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA), starting with 18 daily departures and expanding to 79 by November 2025, including international flights. The airport, owned by the Adani Group, aims to handle 20 million passengers annually in its initial phase, with future expansions planned.

title: 'Pigeon impossible': Birds take off without boarding passes, delay Delta flight twice
content: Delta Flight 2348, en route to Madison, Wisconsin, experienced an unusual delay at Minneapolis–Saint Paul International Airport when two pigeons infiltrated the cabin. The flight was twice delayed due to the avian intruders, requiring ground crew intervention to remove them. Passengers and crew cooperated to safely resolve the situation, resulting in a 56-minute delay.

title: Frozen in fear: Video captures panic as Chennai roller coaster halts mid-flight
content: A roller coaster malfunction at a Chennai amusement park left around 30 people, including children and women, stranded nearly 50 feet in the air for three terrifying hours on Monday evening. Panic ensued as riders awaited rescue after the 'Topgun' ride froze mid-air.

title: Devil in the Ozarks: How this cop-turned-killer escaped prison
content: Grant Hardin, a convicted killer, has escaped from a medium-security prison in Arkansas. Hardin, a former police chief, used a calculated disguise resembling a law enforcement outfit to evade detection. The escape has triggered an intense manhunt across the Ozark Mountains, with authorities facing challenges due to the rugged terrain and Hardin's familiarity with the area, leaving the community on edge.

title: Haider Ali – The fruit seller who refused to let go of his cricket dream
content: Haider Ali's journey from a small Pakistani village to the UAE national cricket team is a testament to his unwavering resilience. Overcoming obstacles like working as a waiter, selling fruits during the pandemic, and surviving a near-fatal accident, he persevered to chase his cricketing dream.

title: 'Poor Kamal Haasan': Siddaramaiah takes dig at actor over Kannada-Tamil remark
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah criticised actor Kamal Haasan for his remarks suggesting Kannada originated from Tamil, citing Haasan's ignorance of Kannada's history. BJP President BY Vijayendra also condemned Haasan, demanding an apology for disrespecting the language.

title: DMK announces Rajya Sabha candidates, Kamal Haasan to make parliamentary debut
content: The DMK has announced its candidates for the upcoming Rajya Sabha elections, nominating P Wilson, S R Sivalingam, and poet Salma, while allocating one seat to Kamal Haasan's MNM as part of their alliance. Kamal Haasan is poised to enter the Rajya Sabha, pending formal endorsement from his party.

title: 'Sergey Brins of the world came as students …': Raghuram Rajan warns about risks to US
content: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan has criticised Donald Trump's policy to restrict foreign students, warning of long-term economic consequences for the US. Rajan highlighted the vital role international students play in America's innovation and economic dominance, citing examples like Google's co-founder, Sergey Brin.

title: CBSE and its ‘Mother Tongue First’ move: Bridging learning gaps or widening India’s academic divide?
content: The CBSE has directed all affiliated schools to implement the mother-tongue-first policy from 2025–26, aligning with NCF-2023. While this aims to enhance early learning and equity through regional language instruction, critics warn of practical hurdles in India’s linguistically diverse classrooms. The success of this reform hinges on careful execution, not just ideological appeal.

title: 'Trump = traitor': Harvard protesters slam US President's education war
content: Harvard University faces a tumultuous graduation week as students protest President Trump's decision to cancel federal contracts and revoke the university's authorization to host foreign students. The move, part of Trump's crackdown on elite universities, has sparked outrage and legal challenges. International students fear deportation, while alumni and faculty rally against what they see as an attack on academic freedom and the university's global reputation.

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: PGA Tour axes Tour Championship staggered start
content: the PGA Tour is eliminating the controversial starting-strokes format from the Tour Championship . all 30 players in the field will start at even par in a stroke-play tournament . the winner after 72 holes will capture the FedEx Cup and collect a bonus and five-year PGA tour exemption .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City eyeing move for Cherki
content: al Hilal are looking to sign Napoli striker Victor Osimhen for around €40m . the 26-year-old is set to leave the Serie A champions after spending the last year on loan at Galatasaray .

title: Power Rankings: Storm surge while Fever fall in latest edition
content: caitlin Clark's quad strain is the type of bad news all WNBA franchises must navigate . the loss of a starter is what keeps coaches and general managers awake at night . last season, the Minnesota Lynx went 3-2 without star forward Napheesa Collier .

title: 🏒 NHL free agency big board: Tier rankings
content: the salary cap is projected to rise to $95.5 million next season; $104 million in 2026-27 . it could lead to more teams comfortably retaining their own players on expiring contracts . the unrestricted free agent field is organized into different tiers .

title: Previewing the WCWS: Strengths, (relative) weaknesses for every team
content: the 2025 NCAA softball tournament's overall no. 1 seed (Texas A&M) was knocked out before the super regionals . three unseeded teams took top-7 seeds to a third game, too . do you like star power and chalk instead? despite the upsets above, four-time national champion Oklahoma has scorched its way through the postseason .

title: NBA draft player survey: Who's the most underrated prospect in this class?
content: college basketball insider Jeff Borzello joins draft analysts Jeremy Woo and Jonathan Givony at the draft combine . a small handful received multiple votes, some were named by college teammates, others insisted players featured in ESPN's latest mock draft were still underrated . nominations for players who have since withdrawn from the draft have been omitted .

Vanderbilt, which just won the tournament, is the no. 1 overall seed . the rest of the top eight national seeds are Texas at No. 2, Arkansas at no. 3, Auburn at no . 4, North Carolina at no no. 5, LSU at no 6 and Oregon State at no 8 .
